dlgLine.text: ...And Davis, I'd like you to keep monitoring that radio until we can-
Oh- Vic, this is the woman I've been telling you about.
Oh- Vic, this is the man I've been telling you about.
Right - didn't recognize you without all that blood. Now, if you'll give me a second with Davis, I'll come by and run you through a few tasks I had in mind for you.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm sorry - you'll do what now?
I was under the impression there were more cops than this.

dlgLine.text: Joel - I want you posted up on the roof for the time being.
Uh, yeah - I mean, sure Vic.
But I've been on my feet for the last 24 hours. So if you could wrangle up a cup of coffee and something to eat, I'd really appreciate it.
Oh, yes, sir! I mean, um - I'll be right back!
Maybe I'm not being clear - I haven't had a real night's sleep in days, but it sounds like this isn't sitting right with you? Is that what I'm hearing?
Vic - weren't you just about to tell me about the Sheriff?
From the crash that we pulled your ass out of.
Vic - weren't you just about to tell me about the Sheriff?
Who am I? Aside from the authority in these parts?
Vic - weren't you just about to tell me about the Sheriff?
Yeah... the Sheriff.
<Sigh>... We were on our way to meet cops gathering in Coleman. 'Bout twenty miles from town, our car was shot at and we crashed into a ditch. We were ambushed by about six, maybe seven Coyotes.
Would you let me finish, dammit?
Anyhow, they must've figured we were hurt, 'cause they walked right toward the car. Got three of them right then and there.
Next thing you know, we're behind the car caught in a gunfight. Went on for a half-hour, I figure...
Must've run out of ammo for their rifles, 'cause all of the sudden they start running towards us and the Sheriff and I ended pumping them with six or seven rounds apiece.
Then we notice what they were running from - must of been a dozen of those things crawling out of the grass. Probably people those boys had cut up and left for dead themselves...
One of those sons of bitches must've been bit. While we were finishing off the corpses, dead Coyote came back, took a chunk out of the Sheriff's leg...
I dragged the Sheriff to a secure location. Tried to keep him alive for days - it's all a blur really.
Died yesterday morning... Had to do it myself... you know, after he turned.

dlgAnsw.text: So we have even fewer cops than when you left?

dlgLine.text: Yeah...
We were trying to get reinforcements so we could get the survivors out of Splendid. If we had taken them with us, they'd all be dead right now.
Excuse me?

dlgAnsw.text: That's your version of things - for all I know, you shot the Sheriff and were about to skip town.

dlgLine.text: Listen to me and you listen good - I respected that man, I served alongside him, and I practically carried him back here on my shoulders. You don't know a thing about me or what you're saying and I have a good mind to smash your goddamn face in for even suggestin' it!

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, your story checks out. Wanted to see your reaction, to know if I could trust you.
Sorry, I suspected you - from the way Joel described you, I thought you might be that kind of person.

dlgLine.text: You got a nerve pushing a man like that to satisfy your own fucked up curiosity.
That right? Well, Joel and I are going to have a long talk then.
The fact is - I'm back and the people at this school are still in danger. We're going be in this mess for the long haul, and someone's got to take charge.

dlgAnsw.text: Well, it's good to have you with us, but I've kind of had things under control at the school.
I've been managing the place just fine, but I could definitely use a deputy.
Someone has taken charge - me. Is that going to be a problem for you?

dlgLine.text: I appreciate what you've done, but I can take it from here.

dlgAnsw.text: Oh, yeah... I'm sure you'd be great at it. But, I think I'm already doing a pretty good job.
What I meant to say is - get used to doing things my way, because that's how we're doing things.
I'm in charge. Deal with it.

dlgLine.text: I'm sure you did what you had to do - but the fact is, I'm the closest thing to an authority figure this town has anymore. If you're willing to help, great, I could use all the cooperation I can get.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm trying to cooperate here. I need your help, but it seems to me you want to be in charge for the sake of being in charge.
You're the deputy of a town the size of my grocery store and you think that makes you qualified?
I'm in charge. Deal with it.

dlgLine.text: And who put you in charge, huh? Last time I checked, I'm the closest thing this town has to an authority figure.
We didn't know if you were coming back. We needed someone to step up and she did. It was my call.
We didn't know if you were coming back. We needed someone to step up and he did. It was my call.
Yeah... And how's that been going - let's talk about that.
I don't even know who you are! I've been the law here for a good long time - you think I don't know what's best for this town?
We didn't know if you were coming back. We needed someone to step up and she did. It was my call.
We didn't know if you were coming back. We needed someone to step up and he did. It was my call.
Yeah... And how's that been going - let's talk about that.
The fence is up - I'll give you that.
But Joel had orders from the Sheriff to keep the place locked down. He's the authority in these parts, you're not. People start disobeying the police and - well, everything goes to shit.

dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: isShelterCharDead(1003) == False && isShelterCharDead(1008) == False && isShelterCharDead(1012) == False
isShelterCharDead(1003) == True || isShelterCharDead(1008) == True || isShelterCharDead(1012) == True

dlgLine.text: You didn't get anyone killed building that fence - and knowing how dangerous it is out there, I'd say you got damn lucky.
But because you took that risk - people got killed. That's on you. I told everyone to stay put for a good reason!

You got Joel killed... Now, I know he may not have been the best cop - but he was one of us. He wasn't trained for this - and dammit, that's why we told him to stay in the goddamn basement, where it was safe!
So, here we are... You still think you're in charge, huh?

dlgAnsw.text: That a threat, Vic? You going to let me 'get bit' too, so you can lead this place?
You'd do well to remember that.
It's obvious you don't really want to be in charge. But as an authority figure, you could be a great help to me.
Let's do this - I'll handle day-to-day operations and you could help be the face of the law.

dlgLine.text: I have a duty as a cop... but if you want to handle all the shit people are going to bringing to you - all their grief, all their pettiness, and their cruelty... well, you be my guest.
Okay, you listen to me - I am not going to sit idly by while you do whatever the hell you please. So, you want to stay in charge, you better respect me. We, uh... understand each other?

dlgAnsw.text: Go fuck yourself, you glorified mall cop.

dlgLine.text: Hmm... I suppose I could abide that... but there are going to be some conditions. If I ask you to do something, I expect you to make good on it.
You show me respect, I won't have to rethink our understanding. Now, let's get this place back on track.

dlgAnsw.text: <Vic goes back to talking to Davis.>

dlgLine.text: Dammit - I've got my eye on you!
I've got my eye on you. Now let's get back to work.

dlgAnsw.text: <Vic goes back to talking to Davis.>
